data.meta_description: พิพิธภัณฑ์พระบาทสมเด็จพระปกเกล้าเจ้าอยู่หัว
data.text:
On 16th July 2024, Assistant Professor Dr.Issara Sereewatthanawut, Deputy Secretary-General of King Prajadhipok’s Institute, Dr.Stithorn Thananithichot, Director of the Office of Innovation for Democracy, and Mrs.Kanchana Sripathar, Director of the King Prajadhipok Museum, welcome Mr.Troung Quang Hoai Nam, Vice Chairman of the Central Commission for External Relations (CER), Communist Party of Vietnam and staffs from the Embassy of the Socialist Republic of Vietnam in Thailand, in the occasion of the official visit to Thailand. Both parties met in discussion on issues such as the mission of King Prajadhipok’s Institute, the administration of training courses, research, and academic support to the parliament, nonviolence practice, and good governance.

After the meeting, visitors were invited to visit the King Prajadhipok Museum to learn about the life, works, and legacies of King Prajadhipok and Queen Rambhai Barni to the Kingdom of Thailand. The museum exhibited personal belongings of the royal couple and items from King Prajadhipok’s Reign (1925-1935), which highly impressed the museum’s guests.
